intro: Banisteriopsis quitensis, commonly known as the Peruvian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots are traditionally used in folk medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. However, it is important to note that the plant contains toxic compounds and should be handled with caution.
